body.title: Interpretations

child-item.item: **“Address”** means a postal address or, for the purposes of electronic communication, a fax number, email address or telephone number for receiving text messages;
**“Articles”** means the Company’s articles of association;

body.item: Unless the context requires otherwise, other words or expressions contained in these Articles bear the same meaning as in the Companies Act 2006 as in force on the date when these Articles become binding on the Co-operative. Schedule 1 to the Companies (Model Articles) Regulations 2008 shall apply to the Co-operative, save where amended or replaced by these Articles. In the case of any variation or inconsistency between these Articles and the model articles, these Articles shall prevail.
body.title: Offer of shares and debentures
body.item: The Co-operative is a private company and accordingly shall not offer to the public any type of shares in or debentures of the Co-operative nor shall it allot or agree to allot such shares or debentures with a view to their being offered for sale to the public.
body.title: Purpose
body.item: The purpose of the Co-operative is to carry out its function as a co-operative and to abide by the internationally recognised co-operative values and Co-operative Principles as defined by the International Co-operative Alliance. This article is Entrenched in accordance with section 22 of the Act; any alteration to this article requires the approval of 100% of the Members.
body.title: OBJECTS
body.item: The objects of the Co-operative are specifically restricted to carry on the business as a co-operative……
body.title: POWERS
body.item: To further its objects the Co-operative may do all such lawful things as may further the Co-operative's objects and, in particular, may borrow or raise funds for any purpose.
body.title: MEMBERSHIP
body.item: The first Members of the Co-operative will be the subscribers to the memorandum of association of the Co-operative. Only Employees may be Members of the Co-operative.

item-with-children.item: All Employees on taking up employment with the Co-operative may be admitted to membership of the Co-operative, except that the Co-operative in a general meeting may by a majority vote decide to exclude from membership:

child-item.item: Newly appointed Employees during such reasonable probationary period as may be specified in their terms and conditions of employment;
Employees working less than a prescribed number of hours per week (or per month); provided that any such criteria for exclusion is applied equally to all Employees.

body.item: In accordance with the Co-operative Principle of voluntary and open membership, whilst the Co-operative shall undertake to encourage its Employees to become Members, membership must be voluntary and as a result cannot be a condition of employment.
body.title: Resolutions

item-with-children.item: Decisions at general meetings shall be made by passing resolutions:

child-item.item: Decisions involving an alteration to articles that have been Entrenched in accordance with section 22 of the Act require the approval of 100% of the Members.

item-with-children.item: The following decisions must be made by special resolution:

child-item.item: Decisions involving an alteration to the Articles of the Co-operative, except where an article is Entrenched as detailed above;
Decisions to dispose of assets of the Co-operative equivalent in value to one-third of the Co-operative’s last published balance sheet, as detailed in these Articles;
The decision to wind up the Co-operative;
Other decisions which are required so by statute.
All other decisions shall be made by ordinary resolution.
